Discrete Gamma and Beta distribution

Source: R/terraces.R
terraces.Rd

terraces visualizes in likelihood surface for the tree space (Sanderson ) Usually trees are from a bootstrap or MCMC sample. There the first two axis are the principle components of distances between trees and the third axis is the likelihood value.

Usage

terraces(x, bs_trees = NULL, dist_fun = "RF.dist", di2multi = TRUE,
  tol = 2e-08, plot = TRUE, add = FALSE, ...)

Arguments

x

an object of class pml

bs_trees

an object of class multiPhylo

dist_fun

a function to compute distances between trees see e.g. RF.dist

di2multi

logical, should trees multichotomies get collapsed.

tol

a numeric value giving the tolerance to consider a branch length significantly greater than zero.

plot

loggical if TRUE a 3D scatter is shown.

add

whether to add the points to an existing plot.

...

Further arguments passed to or from other methods.

Value

terraces silently returns a matrix.

See also

pml_bb, optim.pml, pratchet, RF.dist, di2multi, cmdscale.

Author

Klaus Schliep klaus.schliep@gmail.com #' @references Sanderson, M.J., McMahon, M.M. and Steel, M. (2011). Terraces in phylogenetic tree space. Science, 333, 448–450.

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
data(woodmouse)
library(rgl)
fit <- pml_bb(woodmouse, model="JC")
library(rgl)
open3d()
terraces(fit)
} # }
